document_data.name: Alarm
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/67/From the Sorcerer's Scroll|4}}{{Cite dragon/141/Orcs Throw Spells, Too!|27}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Alarm''''' was an [[abjuration]] spell designed to alert its caster.
document_data.Effects: The caster picked an area of no more than {{SI|20|ft|long=yes}} wide that when crossed by a creature the spell would alert the caster. When casting the spell, the caster could choose what creatures would not trigger the alarm. The alarm itself was a "ping" in the mind of the caster that would wake them if they were asleep or an actual sound that lasted for six seconds.
document_data.Components: In addition to [[verbal]] and [[somatic]] components, the spell required a [[material component]], a small [[bell]] and a length of slender [[silver]] [[wire]].
document_data.History: The spell was attributed to [[Netherese arcanist]] [[Decampus]] in {{Yearlink|-1619}} and was originally called ''Decampus's alarm''.
